ygData.subject: Innoruuk stuff (was Race to 60)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Unbidden Blazing Hearts/Avanguardia de Valorian (basically one guild) Ethereal Vortex/Last Alliance (maybe) Those are daytime guilds that most of us don t
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 15 May 2000, Kenneth E. Bachman wrote:

> Well, I think that the Innoruuk guilds with the largest high-level presence (which isn't exactly the same
> thing, but I suspect it's close enough) are, in no particular order:
>
> LoD (Legions of Darkness? never quite sure)
> Pantheon (Sylly's?)
> Storm
> Order of the Black Staff (mine and Harmonic's)
>

Unbidden
Blazing Hearts/Avanguardia de Valorian (basically one guild)
Ethereal Vortex/Last Alliance (maybe)

Those are daytime guilds that most of us don't see very often... EV/LA get
included in my book simply because EV used to be up there with the other
big guilds, and have been around much longer than OBS, Storm, or Unbidden.
But, if you just count number of people, including EV would include a
whole new tier of guilds (a la Justifiers, Technique)

> OBS has about 140 not counting twinks. I think the others are in the
> ballpark. LoD is considered the "uber-guild" of the server, for what
> that's worth.

LoD has 50 active members or so. We're actually one of the smaller
guilds. And for what it's worth, we haven't considered ourselves the
uberguild on the server for quite some time. We get called that by other
guilds alot more than we refer to ourselves as that :P.

Honestly, I think Innoruuk has it good. The top 6 or 7 guilds are close
enough that alot of stuff is done by consensus and we don't have anyone
doing any of the things that FoH is accused of doing on a consistent
basis. Sure, every guild (OBS and LoD included) tries to pull a stunt now
and then, but no one really cares in the long run, cause no one really has
a monopoly on anything.

--
Miriana
Legions of Darkness
Innoruuk Server
